title: Live The Idyllic Greek Vacation Life All At Time At Costa Navarino
description: A vacation life in the unspoiled, coastal Peloponnese can be yours all the time at Costa Navarino
content:
I had long heard about Costa Navarino, a more than 2,400-acre development in Greece’s Peloponnese that has been a game changer in the country’s hospitality scene ever since its first phase opened in 2010. Actually, calling it a development is something of a misnomer- this is a place that’s a full-scale destination and a sustainable one at that, which respects the surrounding land.

Located in the Greek region of Messinia in the southwest, Costa Navarino brings an area to the limelight that locals know about but Americans largely don’t. I, for one, hadn’t heard about it until Costa Navarino came into the picture. Until then, I always associated Greece with Athens, Mykonos, and Santorini.

Costa Navarino comprises four hotels: The Romanos, a Luxury Collection Resort, The Westin Resort Costa Navarino, W Costa Navarino, and Mandarin Oriental, Costa Navarino. Then there are four golf courses, multiple spas and gyms, upwards of 40 restaurants- each tastier than the next, boutiques with fantastic shopping, tennis courts, other sports facilities, and the list goes on and on.

From my recent visit, I can tell you that there’s so much to see and do in the Peloponnese that you would need a lifetime at least to explore the region to the fullest. The ancient sites are endless, the beaches are uncrowded and spectacular, the local towns are full of visit-worthy restaurants and stores, and taking a scenic drive along the coastline is just one of the many ways to explore.

With the residences at Costa Navarino, this dreamy Greek life can be yours all the time. The real estate offering here features multiple neighborhoods and home types to meet a variety of tastes, but what makes them special is that they integrate beautifully into the landscape and impart a distinct sense of place. When I walked through the front doors of the villas I toured, it was clear that I was in the Peloponnese.

In my recent interview with Evgenios Dendrinos, who is the managing director of Costa Navarino’s developer TEMES, I learned more about the appeal of calling this vacation destination “home.”

Why should someone buy a home in Costa Navarino? What's so special about the development?

The residential proposition at Costa Navarino presents a rare opportunity to own a home within a sustainably driven destination, in one of the most pristine coastal regions of the Mediterranean.

It’s one of the few beachfront developments in the Med offering such proximity to the sea, within a fully serviced, gated, and low-density environment, where 90% of the land will remain green forever.

The properties are integrated into the landscape, and homeowners benefit from privileged resort access, high-quality infrastructure, premium property management, and a multitude of authentic experiences, including four golf courses, various sports, wellness, gastronomy, and recreational activities. Owning a home means becoming part of a growing community that is actively engaged with the local culture and surroundings. It’s a destination designed for long-term living — with the infrastructure, services, and quality of life to match.

This exclusive residential offering has garnered strong international interest, with over 85% of the villas within the 130-hectare beachfront Navarino Dunes area, already sold or reserved. This diverse owners’ community includes families from across the world—among them USA, north, central and west Europe, and Greece.

How many homes are there and what types of properties are available?

Costa Navarino offers a curated range of private residences, featuring bespoke (off-plan) and turn-key villas with 5 to 7 bedrooms, in plots ranging from 1,570 m² - 2,200 m² and interiors from 470 m² to 630 m².

Can you describe the different neighborhoods and how each is distinct?

Sea Dunes, just 30 meters from the beach, offers large, low-rise 6-bedroom villas, affording sweeping Ionian views, ample space and privacy. They are offered off-plan, with extensive customization options.

Olive Grove has turnkey 5 bedroom villas with extensive customization options. Owners enjoy stunning sea and golf views from garden level, in the privacy of verdant olive groves.

What is the price range?

Current pricing starts from €6.5 million for off-plan residences at the Sea Dunes neighborhood and from €6.4 million for turn-key residences at the Olive Grove neighborhood.

What is the design style of the properties? Are there varying styles?

The architecture blends contemporary luxury with bioclimatic design, using natural local materials, stone facades, and earth tones in perfect harmony with the landscape. Villas are designed with planted roofs, open layouts blending indoor and outdoor living, and extensive customization options. The strict design guidelines ensure full alignment with the region’s traditional architectural patterns.

What benefits do homeowners have?

Owners enjoy access to resort facilities (golf, spa, sports, kids’ programs, leisure activities, authentic experiences, etc), concierge and property management, membership at the exclusive Owners’ Club, 24/7 security, and rental management programs, for renting their villa when they’re not using it

What about the surrounding infrastructure?

Costa Navarino is located close to Kalamata International Airport (approx. 45 mins), which offers international and domestic connections. The marina in Pylos and the Bay of Navarino in general, provide safe anchorages for private yachts, sailing boats and cruise ships. From Kalamata to Pylos, the surrounding cities and villages offer a variety of experiences, from dining to nightlife, as well as well-equipped hospitals, commercial and shopping districts, including Navarino Agora: a modern marketplace for dining, shopping, and cultural events.

How safe is Costa Navarino and the wider area?

All resort areas at Costa Navarino offer a gated, secure community with 24/7 services. The wider Messinia region is known for its low crime rates, warm hospitality, and strong local traditions, making it a safe and welcoming place to live year-round.
summary: Costa Navarino, a more than 2,400-acre development in Greece's Peloponnese, has been a major player in the country's hospitality scene since its first phase opened in 2010. The resort, which includes four hotels, four golf courses, multiple spas and gyms, and over 40 restaurants. The residences at Costa Navarinos can be purchased for a lifetime, offering a unique opportunity to own a home within a sustainably driven destination in one of the most pristine coastal regions of the Mediterranean. The property offers multiple neighborhoods and home types that blend seamlessly into the landscape. The current housing price range starts from €6-5 million.
shortSummary: Costa Navarino, a sprawling 2,400-acre development in Greece’s Peloponnese, offers exceptional residential, golf courses, and extensive outdoor activities.

scraped_sources.text:
The story of Costa Navarino is as old as Greece itself. It was wise King Nestor, legendary ruler of ancient Pylos, who first gave meaning to the word “hospitality” when he befriended complete strangers. This is a place where friendship can always be found, where happiness is measured by footsteps in the sand.
Costa Navarino is located in Messinia in the southwest Peloponnese, in one of the most unspoiled and breathtaking landscapes in the Mediterranean. Its philosophy is driven by a genuine desire to promote Messinia, while protecting and preserving not only its natural beauty but also a remarkable cultural heritage spanning 4,500 years.
Costa Navarino is currently home to four 5-star premium resorts, Mandarin Oriental Costa Navarino, W Costa Navarino, The Romanos, a Luxury Collection Resort and The Westin Resort Costa Navarino, three spa centres, four signature 18-hole golf courses, over 40 dining venues, a wide range of sports, outdoor and cultural activities, plus an array of 5-star services. The destination is enriched by Navarino Agora, a curated marketplace and incubator of art and culture that combines shopping, dining and entertainment with cultural happenings.
Navarino Residences, a collection of luxury villas for private ownership, present a unique opportunity to acquire luxury freehold real estate in Greece. Located in the heart of Navarino Dunes just a few meters from the beach or nestled among verdant olive groves, Navarino Residences offer much more than a residential proposition – they are a way of life.
Named “World’s Best Emerging Golf Destination 2022” by World Golf Awards, Costa Navarino offers a world-class golf experience with its four 18-hole signature courses: The Dunes Course, set in diverse natural scenery with spectacular sea and river views, takes its name from the tall dunes that separate several holes from a golden beach, The Bay Course offers panoramic sea and mountain views, with two holes playing along the historic Bay of Navarino while The International Olympic Academy Golf Course and The Hills Course offer players a challenging game and breath taking sunsets.
Situated near the attractive town of Pylos in Messinia, Costa Navarino upholds the highest standards of environmental and social responsibility through all development stages from construction to operation. Costa Navarino follows a meticulously planned environmental policy to protect the environment and natural resources of the region and at the same time improve the overall quality of living. A premier luxury travel destination in Greece, Costa Navarino aims to offer a world of authentic experiences, always with respect for the natural environment, the local community and the region’s rich history and culture.

argos_summary: Costa Navarino is a vast, sustainable luxury resort in Greece's Peloponnese, featuring four hotels, multiple golf courses, and extensive recreational facilities. It offers a unique residential opportunity with villas that blend into the landscape, providing homeowners access to premium amenities and a vibrant community. The development emphasizes environmental responsibility and cultural heritage, making it a desirable destination for both vacation and long-term living.
